Women Changing the World. Start-up CEO consultant and business development specialist for project or time specific endeavors.  Business mentor and consultant to entrepreneurs and entrepreneurial training programs nationally.
NAWBO Circle Program Director (current), Past Chair, PASC and National Board member
National Association of Women Business Owners

Proudly serving as the Program Director for the National NAWBO Circle of multi-million dollar women business owners across the United States.Connections, monthly masterminds, retreats, high-level education, further expansion, confidential and top-tier trusted relationships is what we are about.Worked as a National Board Member of National Association of Women Business Owners (www.nawbo.org) on the development team and now am the Project Director of the NAWBO Circle through their non-profit organization, The Institute for Entrepreneurial Development. The NAWBO Circle is a year-long peer connection and educational program for women business owners with annual revenue exceeding $1 million. The Circle serves high level women business owners from across the nation with monthly video conference peer groups, 3 retreats per year, high level educational webinars, and face-to-face meet ups with keynote speakers and international icons. Designed to provide the kind of close relationships, education and connections that propel women business owners into greater success, the Circle ensures that for women business owners, it no longer "lonely" at the top!Current Director of Strategy and Development for the Phoenix NAWBO board.Past chair of the President's Assembly Steering Committee for the National Board of NAWBO.Past National Board member of NAWBO.Past President of the Phoenix Chapter of NAWBO from 2012/2013.  Have served on the Phoenix board since 2009. Support and connection advocate to link the National organization with the 24 President's and chapter leaders of the NAWBO chapters in the Western United States.As a local and national NAWBO member, I support the mission of NAWBO to STRENGTHEN the wealth-creating capacity of our members and promote economic development; CREATE innovative and effective changes in the business culture; BUILD strategic alliances, coalitions, and affiliations; and TRANSFORM public policy and influence opinion.

Launched the first Young Entrepreneur's Academy in Arizona in 2013 through NAWBO Phoenix on the campus of Grand Canyon University.  Continuing the program for the 2014/2015 academic year and beyond on the campus of Phoenix College, championed by the Arizona Hispanic Chamber of Commerce Foundation..This is a ground-breaking 6-month after-school program for High School students where they create, plan, pitch, register and market real businesses by the time they graduate high school! The only hands-on, real-world entrepreneurial incubator for High School students of its kind, we were the first High School focused entrepreneurial start-up incubator in Arizona. We have successfully launched 29 new, funded, exceptional businesses completely owned and operated by their High School founders!   We are positively changing the lives of the next generation of educated, motivated and successful business owners.  www.yeahphx.org

Expansion of my 8 year old coaching practice to focus on pre-commitment and pre-marital coaching for couples who want a lifetime together full of love, commitment, respect, intimacy and growth. Love does not discriminate; and neither do we. All couples welcome.www.relationshipinsurance.guru

Professional coaching, mentoring and training serving both the corporate and the private sectors.  Strategic business development and relationship management focus through the concepts of servant leadership for building ethical, sustainable and profitable businesses. Corporate programs include serving clients nationwide with leadership, building skilled and motivated work teams, customer service and empathy training coupled with ongoing coaching for change sustainability.Private sector programs include specializing in supporting women in business and on a personal level with navigating change and effective networking and community building.  Small business mentoring for women entrepreneurs. Self-Esteem building for teens and pre-teens through special community service programs.Most requested training workshops include:  Emotional Intelligence, Making Decisions with Confidence, and Building Empathy Skills.

Member of the International Coach  Federation, Phoenix Chapter. Team Women of Scottsdale, Powerful You! Women's Network, Heart Link Network, Little Pink Book of Scottsdale, Founder of The Women's Circle Network.

June 2, 2017, Pamela worked with Lynda in the same group

I have had the pleasure of  collaborating with Pamela Manwaring over this past year as she has headed up the Young Entrepreneurs Academy for the Ahwatukee Chamber of Commerce.  As a "veteran" YEA Program director, I knew both the joys and challenges that Pamela would face in her first year of programming such an impactful and volunteer-heavy program only in its second year in the community.  Pamela continually impressed me with her positive attitude, her dedication to the students and her creative thinking in how to give her students the kind of experience that would grow them into collaborative, confident, problem solving young adults.  During times of success, Pamela was quick to share credit and during times of challenge, she consistently kept her sense of humor and her sense of personality responsibility to see it through and be a true leader.  It has been an honor to travel this road with Pamela - she has made a true difference!

summary: I am an action based, high energy leader, director and facilitator of change through supporting purposeful leadership, strengthening people and relationships, building strong businesses and connections both locally and internationally.My amazing teams are changing the world through purposeful leadership, compassion and a connected and growing entrepreneurial community. Creating, nurturing and growing great relationships is at the core of all of my business ventures and personal mission. See more at www.lyndabishop.com   With a professional certification as an empowerment coach and a masters degree in professional counseling, I am providing leadership development mentoring and program facilitation to private individuals, groups and progressive companies who understand that people are the great asset and that both men and women belong at the top.  I am the Program Director for the NAWBO Circle of multi-million dollar women business owners from across the United States.  I have served on the board of the National Association of Women Business Owners (NAWBO) for the past 9 years; including President of the Phoenix chapter and 3 years with the National board.As a top level executive and a mentor for entrepreneurs, I thrive in the excitement, possibilities and structure of dream business creation. In 2012, I helped launch the first Young Entrepreneurs Academy in Arizona. I proudly serve as Program Director today for the largest and most successful program in our state. I serve as the President of Girls Rule Foundation (www.girlsrulefoundation.org) - creating strong, confident, purposeful female leaders of tomorrow.Passions: Expanding leadership in women and girls. Building strong relationships and communities of solid businesses of thriving people. Specialties: Teamwork,relationships. community builder, business development, program implementation, leadership development, relationship expert, small business mentoring, emotional intelligence facilitator.
name: Lynda Bishop
title: CEO; Leadership Development & Relationship Management
